version_description: This is exactly how he plays it in his live version i.e. without any capo. To play like the studio version, you'll need a capo on the First fret. And in the verse, you want to play the F chord in an open position. That way u give continuation to the C bass and it sounds better. Here's the link to the live version https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LSQKhRnYZts.

version_description: My version has a better format with the chords written above the lyrics instead of in between the lyrics. Plus, it includes the background chords during the solo, interlude, plus the chords during the intro which aren't included in the other version. Plus I included the last part of the final chorus. My version has all the parts of the song clearly labeled AND the time signature.
Intro and Solo riffs included with simplified tabs within the chords.
This version has the chorus written out overtime so you can play the song through with the autoscroll feature w/out having to pull the screen down multiple times to view the chorus lyrics/chords.

song_name: Hey Honey - Im Packin You In

version_description: This tab is based on the studio recorded version of the song, from the album Into The Fire.
